fields.title: Tutorial ‚Äì Images using Cloudinary
fields.description: Learn how to add support for images by integrating Cloudinary in Dossier.

children.text: Add support for a new component type and uploading images using Cloudinary.
Dossier doesn't store images itself, instead you can integrate with external services. For this tutorial we will use

After signing up for a Cloudinary project, go to Setting, Upload and click on "Add upload preset". We change "Signing Mode" to "Unsigned" and set the folder to "Tutorial". Click on "Save" and copy the "Upload preset name".

data.alt: Configuration of the new upload preset in Cloudinary

children.text: (if you want to use your own Cloudinary project, override the configuration in
Next, add the dependency that includes a Cloudinary field editor:
In order to support Cloudinary in the schema we want to add a component type called
were we can add an image. We could do it through the web interface, but instead we'll do it in
provides a definition of the type with all the fields:
When the backend is restarted we can see that the component type is set up:

[be] info: Updated schema, new schema has 1 entity types, 1 component types, 0 patterns, 0 indexes
In the frontend we expose the configuration in

And that's it. Now we can add a component of type

data.alt: Screenshot of web interface with no image

children.text: Which will show the Cloudinary upload widget.

data.alt: Screenshot of web interface with the Cloudinary upload widget

children.text: When the image has been uploaded, a preview of the image is shown, and it's possible to add alt text.

data.alt: Screenshot of web interface with thumbnail of the uploaded image
